title: Introduction to predatoR
text: section, show use predatoR package mutation impact prediction. predatoR package makes prediction impact mutation based Adaboost model classifies mutations Pathogenic Neutral. Model created using Varibench ClinVar datasets. Missense3D dataset also used method comparison.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: can install predatoR via devtools:
code: library(devtools) install_github("berkgurdamar/predatoR")

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: predatoR() function wrapper function predatoR package. predatoR() gets data.frame structure input. Input contain 5 mandatory 1 optional columns. Mandatory columns ‘PDB_ID’, ‘Chain’, ‘Position’, ‘Orig_AA’ ‘Mut_AA’. ‘Gene_Name’ column optional. Predictions can made using 2 different models, 7 Angstrom (Å)-atoms model 5Å-carbon alpha (Cα) atoms model. predatoR() function works PDB ID respectively. PDB ID; Downloads/Reads PDB file Calculates distance atom structure Creates network PDB Calculates Degree Centrality Z-Score atom Calculates Eigen Centrality Z-Score atom Calculates Shortest Path Z-Score atom Calculates Betweenness Z-Score atom Calculates Clique Z-Score atom Calculates PageRank Z-Score atom Gets gnomAD Synonymous Z-Score, Missense Z-Score, pLI Score Gets BLOSUM62 score mutation Finds number KEGG Pathways contains input gene Gets Genic Intolerance Score Finds number GO terms associated input gene Finds number diseases associated input gene DisGeNET Gets Gene Essentiality Score Online Gene Essentiality (OGEE) Database Calculates median gene expression value input gene GTEx Calculates 6 different features Accessible Surface Area Hydrophobicity Scale reference mutant amino acids Makes prediction predatoR() couldn’t find information gene ‘Genic Intolerance Score’, inputs removed query prediction step.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: predatoR() function 6 arguments; info_df: Input data.frame PDB_path: PDB file path user wants use PDB structures stored locally (default = NULL) n_threads: Number threads (default = NULL) gene_name_info: Whether gene name information input (default = TRUE) distance_cutoff: distance cutoff setting edges (default = 7) network_approach: network building approach; “” (default) using atoms “ca” using Cα atoms running predatoR() function, gene name included input, gene_name_info set TRUE. gene name information input (gene_name_info = FALSE), predatoR() function gets related gene names Ensembl multiple genes annotated PDB ID, choose gene higher gnomAD metrics. predatoR() can make predictions using 7Å 5Å distance cutoffs. exploratory purposes, different cutoffs can used network properties can calculated. Example input ‘Gene_Name’ information included: Example input ‘Gene_Name’ information included: predatoR() function can also work gene name inputs. mutation gene name information, gets related gene names Ensembl multiple genes annotated PDB ID, gets gene maximum GnomAD scores (gene_name_info set TRUE). predatoR() function uses max_thread_number - 1 default n_threads = NULL. n_threads can set user. predatoR() function downloads PDB default (PDB_path = NULL) can use PDB files stored locally PDB_path specified. automatically read process input PDB file path.
code: library(predatoR) prediction_result <- predatoR(test_data, gene_name_info = TRUE) prediction_result <- predatoR(test_data, gene_name_info = FALSE) prediction_result <- predatoR(test_data, gene_name_info = TRUE) prediction_result <- predatoR(test_data, n_threads = 8) # 8 threads will be used prediction_result <- predatoR(test_data, PDB_path = "path/to/PDB/files/")

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: predatoR() function returns data.frame contains additional two columns; ‘Prediction’ ‘Probability’. ‘Prediction’ represents result impact prediction ‘Probability’ represents probability mutation classified Pathogenic Neutral.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: Network properties can calculated using different distance cutoffs. approach, predatoR() make prediction mutation, returns data frame contains 24 features annotated dataset. network formalisation approaches also can used.
code: # networks build using all atoms and 7.6Å cutoff prediction_result <- predatoR(test_data, distance_cutoff = 7.6, network_approach = "all")   # networks build using only Cα atoms and 8Å cutoff prediction_result <- predatoR(test_data, distance_cutoff = 8, network_approach = "ca")

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: wrapper function predatoR() uses utility functions ; read_PDB() PDB2connections() degree_score() eigen_centrality_score() shorteset_path_score() betweenness_score() clique_score() pagerank_score() gnomad_scores() BLOSUM62_score() KEGG_pathway_number() genic_intolerance() GO_terms() DisGeNET() gene_essentiality() GTEx() amino_acid_features() impact_prediction()

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: read_PDB() function downloads input PDB default can read process locally stored PDB structures. reading, create matrix contains ATOM labelled structures.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: read_PDB() 3 arguments; PDB_ID: PDB ID (E.g. “3SQJ”) PDB_path: PDB file path files stored locally (default = FALSE) network_approach: network building approach; “” (default) using atoms “ca” using Cα atoms

title: Introduction to predatoR
code: # if file stored locally PDB_2DN2_structure <- read_PDB("3SQJ", PDB_path = "path/to/PDB/files/")  # if file is going to be downloded PDB_2DN2_structure <- read_PDB("3SQJ")

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: PDB2connections() function calculates distances ATOM PDB structure creates edge atoms distance <= 7Å. result, returns list contains data frames different chains’ interaction lists.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: PDB2connections() 5 arguments; atom_matrix: Matrix created read_PDB() function filtered_info_df: data.frame contains one PDB entries n_threads: number threads (default = NULL) single_run: set TRUE using PDB2connections() function alone (default = TRUE) distance_cutoff: distance cutoff setting edges (default = 7)

title: Introduction to predatoR
code: test_data <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 3, "HIS", "GLN", "ALB"),                                  c("3SQJ", "A", 60, "GLU", "LYS","ALB"))) colnames(test_data) <- c("PDB_ID", "Chain", "Position", "Orig_AA", "Mut_AA", "Gene_Name") edge_list <- PDB2connections(atom_matrix = PDB_2DN2_structure, filtered_info_df = test_data, n_threads = 8, single_run = TRUE)

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: degree_score() function calculates total number connections nodes. Calculates Z-scores node returns scores desired nodes.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: degree_score() 2 arguments; edge_list: List created PDB2connections() function filtered_info_df: data.frame contains one PDB entries

title: Introduction to predatoR
code: test_data <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 3, "HIS", "GLN", "ALB"),                                  c("3SQJ", "A", 60, "GLU", "LYS","ALB"))) colnames(test_data) <- c("PDB_ID", "Chain", "Position", "Orig_AA", "Mut_AA", "Gene_Name") degree_z_score <- degree_score(edge_list = edge_list, filtered_info_df = test_data)

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: eigen_centrality_score() function calculates total number connections nodes node connected. Calculates Z-scores nodes returns scores desired nodes.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: eigen_centrality_score() 2 arguments; edge_list: List created PDB2connections() function filtered_info_df: data.frame contains one PDB entries

title: Introduction to predatoR
code: test_data <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 3, "HIS", "GLN", "ALB"),                                  c("3SQJ", "A", 60, "GLU", "LYS","ALB"))) colnames(test_data) <- c("PDB_ID", "Chain", "Position", "Orig_AA", "Mut_AA", "Gene_Name") eigen_centrality_z_score <- eigen_centrality_score(edge_list = edge_list, filtered_info_df = test_data)

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: shorteset_path_score() function calculates distances node via shortest.paths() function igraph package, sum distances nodes, calculates Z-scores returns scores desired nodes.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: shorteset_path_score() 2 arguments; edge_list: List created PDB2connections() function filtered_info_df: data.frame contains one PDB entries

title: Introduction to predatoR
code: test_data <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 3, "HIS", "GLN", "ALB"),                                  c("3SQJ", "A", 60, "GLU", "LYS","ALB"))) colnames(test_data) <- c("PDB_ID", "Chain", "Position", "Orig_AA", "Mut_AA", "Gene_Name") shorteset_path_z_score <- shorteset_path_score(edge_list = edge_list, filtered_info_df = test_data)

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: betweenness_score() function calculates Betweenness Score node using betweenness() function igraph package, turns scores Z-scores returns scores desired nodes.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: betweenness_score() 2 arguments; edge_list: List created PDB2connections() function filtered_info_df: data.frame contains one PDB entries

title: Introduction to predatoR
code: test_data <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 3, "HIS", "GLN", "ALB"),                                  c("3SQJ", "A", 60, "GLU", "LYS","ALB"))) colnames(test_data) <- c("PDB_ID", "Chain", "Position", "Orig_AA", "Mut_AA", "Gene_Name") betweenness_z_score <- betweenness_score(edge_list = edge_list, filtered_info_df = test_data)

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: clique_score() function calculates Clique Z-scores score atom returns desired nodes’ scores.

text: clique_score() 4 arguments; edge_list: List created PDB2connections() function filtered_info_df: data.frame contains one PDB entries n_threads: number threads (default = NULL) single_run: set TRUE using clique_score() function alone (default = TRUE)

title: Introduction to predatoR
code: test_data <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 3, "HIS", "GLN", "ALB"),                                  c("3SQJ", "A", 60, "GLU", "LYS","ALB"))) colnames(test_data) <- c("PDB_ID", "Chain", "Position", "Orig_AA", "Mut_AA", "Gene_Name") clique_z_score <- clique_score(edge_list = edge_list, filtered_info_df = test_data, n_threads = 8, single_run = TRUE)

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: pagerank_score() function assigns importance score every node via page_rank() function igraph package. Turns scores Z-scores returns scores desired nodes.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: gnomad_scores() function gets input gene’s gnomAD Synonymous Z-Score, Missense Z-Score, PLI Score data retrieved gnomAD. gene name information input, gnomad_scores() finds genes related input PDB chain ID using dataset retrieved Ensembl. multiple genes annotated PDB Chain ID, gnomad_scores() function gets gene maximum Synonymous Z-Score, Missense Z-Score, pLI Score.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: impact_prediction() function makes impact prediction classifies mutation Pathogenic Neutral.

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: impact_prediction() 3 arguments; final_df: data.frame contains required information impact prediction distance_cutoff: distance cutoff setting edges (default = 7) network_approach: network building approach; “” (default) using atoms “ca” using Cα atoms

title: Introduction to predatoR
text: input data.frame containing PDB_ID, Chain, Position, Orig_AA, Mut_AA, Gene_Name, degree_z_score, eigen_z_score, shortest_path_z, betwenness_scores_z, clique_z_score, pagerank_z_score, syn_z, mis_z, pLI, blosum62_scores, kegg_pathway_number, genic_intolerance, go_terms, disgenet, gene_essentiality, gtex, ref_asa, mut_asa, asa_diff, ref_hyd, mut_hyd hyd_diff scores impact_prediction() function classifies mutation Pathogenic Neutral. Example input:
code: prediction_result <- impact_prediction(final_df)

title: Mutation Impact Prediction Based on Network Properties
text: predatoR tool mutation impact prediction based network properties.  predatoR() function wrapper function predatoR package. predatoR() works PDB respectively. PDB; Downloads/Reads PDB file Calculates distance atom structure Creates network PDB Calculates Degree Centrality Z-Score atom Calculates Eigen Centrality Z-Score atom Calculates Shortest Path Z-Score atom Calculates Betweenness Z-Score atom Calculates Clique Z-Score atom Calculates PageRank Z-Score atom Gets gnomAD Synonymous Z-Score, Missense Z-Score, pLI Score Gets BLOSUM62 score mutation Finds number KEGG Pathways contains input gene Gets Genic Intolerance Score Finds number GO terms associated input gene Finds number diseases associated input gene DisGeNET Gets Gene Essentiality Score Online Gene Essentiality (OGEE) Database Calculates median gene expression value input gene GTEx Calculates 6 different features Accessible Surface Area Hydrophobicity Scale reference mutant amino acids Makes prediction

title: Mutation Impact Prediction Based on Network Properties
text: can install predatoR via devtools:
code: library(devtools) install_github("berkgurdamar/predatoR")

title: Mutation Impact Prediction Based on Network Properties
text: Mutation impact prediction can done via predatoR() function: predatoR() uses data.frame structures input. data.frame consist ‘PDB_ID’, ‘Chain’, ‘Position’, ‘Orig_AA’, ‘Mut_AA’ ‘Gene_Name’ (optional). Predictions can made using 2 different models, 7 Angstrom (Å)-atoms model 5Å-carbon alpha (Cα) atoms model. predatoR() can work input partially included gene names. predatoR() function returns data.frame contains additional two columns; ‘Prediction’ ‘Probability’. ‘Prediction’ represents result impact prediction ‘Probability’ represents probability mutation classified Pathogenic Neutral.
code: library(predatoR) # Gene name included input_df <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 196, "GLN", "LEU", "ALB"),                                c("3SQJ", "A", 396, "GLU", "LYS", "ALB"))) pred_res <- predatoR(info_df =  input_df, n_threads = 8, gene_name_info = TRUE) # Gene name not included input_df <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 196, "GLN", "LEU"),                                c("3SQJ", "A", 396, "GLU", "LYS"))) pred_res <- predatoR(info_df =  input_df, n_threads = 8, gene_name_info = FALSE) # Partially included gene names input_df <- as.data.frame(rbind(c("3SQJ", "A", 196, "GLN", "LEU", "ALB"),                                c("3SQJ", "A", 396, "GLU", "LYS", ""))) pred_res <- predatoR(info_df =  input_df, n_threads = 8, gene_name_info = TRUE)

title: Mutation Impact Prediction Based on Network Properties
text: Network properties can calculated using different distance cutoffs. approach, predatoR() make prediction mutation, returns data frame contains 24 features annotated dataset. network formalisation approaches also can used.
code: # networks build using all atoms and 7.6Å cutoff prediction_result <- predatoR(input_df, distance_cutoff = 7.6, network_approach = "all")   # networks build using only Cα atoms and 8Å cutoff prediction_result <- predatoR(input_df, distance_cutoff = 8, network_approach = "ca")

title: Mutation Impact Prediction Based on Network Properties
text: wrapper function predatoR() uses utility functions ; read_PDB() PDB2connections() degree_score() eigen_centrality_score() shorteset_path_score() betweenness_score() clique_score() pagerank_score() gnomad_scores() BLOSUM62_score() KEGG_pathway_number() genic_intolerance() GO_terms() DisGeNET() gene_essentiality() GTEx() amino_acid_features() impact_prediction() Utility functions can used alone, detail please see vignette via vignette("predatoR_Vignette").

code: predatoR(   info_df,   PDB_path = NULL,   n_threads = NULL,   gene_name_info = TRUE,   distance_cutoff = 7,   network_approach = "all" )

title: Mutation impact Prediction — predatoR
text: info_df data.frame containing 'PDB_ID', 'Chain', 'Position', 'Reference Amino Acid', 'Mutated Amino Acid' 'Gene_Name' (optional) information respectively. PDB_path PDB file path (default = NULL) n_threads number threads (default = NULL) gene_name_info whether gene name information input (default = TRUE) distance_cutoff distance cutoff setting edges (default = 7) network_approach network building approach; "" (default) using atoms "ca" using carbon alpha atoms

title: Mutation impact Prediction — predatoR
text: data.frame contains prediction results

title: Mutation impact Prediction — predatoR
text: input data.frame contains 'PDB_ID', 'Chain', 'Position', 'Reference Amino Acid', 'Mutated Amino Acid' 'Gene_Name' (optional) information respectively, make prediction impact mutation classifies mutation 'Pathogenic' 'Neutral'. Predictions can done using 7 angstrom cutoff - atom approach 5 angstrom cutoff - ca atom approach. cutoffs can used exploratory purposes.
